sections.title: BIOS
sections.content: The BIOS and the boot menu can be accessed by using the alternative power button, which is a small circular one on the left side near by the main power button.

sections.title: Wireless
sections.content: Works after installing the proprietary driver module broadcom-wl or broadcom-wl-dkms, which supports Broadcom BCM43142. See the detailed Broadcom wireless page for further information.

sections.title: Backlight
sections.content:
Use one of the backlight utilities (tested with lightAUR) to adjust the backlight and control it with keyboard shortcuts by the method of your choice.

With kernel 4.0.x backlight can still be changed, but the keys for increasing or decreasing backlight brightness do not work anymore.

sections.title: Audio
sections.content: Install alsa-utils. See ALSA for detailed information. To turn on the internal microphone, start alsamixer and increase the volume.

sections.title: SD Card Reader
sections.content: This requires the rtsx_usb module [1]. Load the module and blacklist sdhci, sdhci_acpi and sdhci_pci, or install lenovo-s20-30AUR, then regenerate the initramfs.

sections.title: Changing fan mode
sections.content:
The fan mode can be changed with echo 'X'>/sys/bus/platform/drivers/ideapad_acpi/VPC2004:00/fan_mode provided by the ideapad-laptop kernel module, where X defines the fan cooling mode, i.e X can be one of the following possibilities:

- 1 = interval cooling
- 2 = regulate fan speed depending on temperature (default, but shows 133 or 5 by inspecting with cat)

In fan cooling mode 2, the fan starts, if the CPU temperature reaches 35°C and stops after the temperature is lower than 31°C.
